alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 11:35PM CDT until June 10 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Childress County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Motley County in northwestern Texas... Northern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Hall County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1135 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Dodson to 6 miles northwest of Childress to 6 miles southeast of Turkey, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Childress, Northfield, Cee Vee, Tell, Kirkland, and Swearingen. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
